articles.description: Trevon Bluiett followed his worst shooting performance of the season with a 37-point effort, and No. 4 Xavier held on for a 102-90 victory over Seton Hall on Wednesday night, securing the Musketeers' hold on first place in the Big East.
articles.headline: Bluiett scores 37, No. 4 Xavier beats Seton Hall 102-90

images.caption: Xavier's Trevon Bluiett converts his eighth 3-pointer of the night, from way downtown.
images.name: Bluiett nails 8th 3 way behind 3-point line

articles.description: Reed Timmer scored a career-high 39 points to lead Drake as it downed Indiana State 90-76 on Wednesday night.
articles.headline: Timmer leads with 39 points as Drake downs Indiana St. 90-76

articles.description: Shamorie Ponds continued his remarkable run with 26 points and a career-high 10 assists and St. John's continued its turnaround with a 77-76 win over DePaul on Wednesday night.
articles.headline: Ponds leads St. John's past DePaul 77-76 for 4th straight

articles.description: Doral Moore scored 17 points, Bryant Crawford added 16 and Wake Forest beat Georgia Tech 79-62 on Wednesday night.
articles.headline: Wake Forest snaps 3-game skid, beats Georgia Tech 79-62

articles.description: Bryce Brown returned from a shoulder injury to score 18 points and make four 3-pointers in leading No. 10 Auburn to a 76-66 victory over Kentucky on Wednesday night.
articles.headline: Brown, Harper lead No. 10 Auburn past Kentucky, 76-66

images.caption: Anfrnee McLemore throws down two alley-oops with authority.
images.name: Tigers' McLemore has some serious hops

articles.description: Joe Rosga scored 28 points with four 3-pointers, Daniel Amigo added 21 points, and Denver never trailed in beating Omaha 94-78 on Wednesday night to split the season series.
articles.headline: Denver downs Omaha 94-78 behind Rosga's 28 points
